'''Alsea, S.A.B. de C.V.''', known as '''Alsea''', is a [[Mexico|Mexican]] multi-brand restaurant operator based in [[Mexico City]], [[Mexico]]. Its operating portfolio includes [[fast-food]], [[casual dining]], and [[cafeteria]] type restaurant chains located in [[Mexico]], [[South America]] and [[Spain]]. It is one of the largest [[foodservice]] companies in Mexico according to [[CNN Expansión]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.cnnexpansion.com/rankings/interactivo-las-500/2014 |title=Top 10 del Ranking 2014 |publisher=CNN Expansión |accessdate=2014-06-26 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140627121854/http://www.cnnexpansion.com/rankings/interactivo-las-500/2014 |archivedate=2014-06-27 }}</ref> 

Some of the restaurant chains that Alsea operates are: [[Starbucks]], [[Burger King]], Vips, [[Domino's Pizza]], Italianni's, [[Chili's]],   [[California Pizza Kitchen]], [[P. F. Chang's]], and [[The Cheesecake Factory]].<ref> [http://www.alsea.net/uploads/pdf/es/alsea_presentacion_relacion_con_inversionitstass_1T15.pdf Alsea. Investor Relations]</ref>

Alsea reported revenues of US$ 1.7 billion for 2014. It operates more than 3,093 units of restaurant chains in [[Mexico]], [[Spain]], [[Chile]], [[Argentina]], [[Colombia]] and [[Brazil]], and employs more than 60,000 people.<ref> [http://ww.alsea.net/uploads/pdf/es/alsea_iinforme_anual_2014.pdf Alsea's 2014 Annual Report]</ref> 
Alsea is listed on the [[Mexican Stock Exchange]] and is a constituent of the [[Indice de Precios y Cotizaciones|IPC]], the main benchmark index of Mexican stocks.

In 2014, Alsea acquired the Mexican restaurant chain Vips and the Spanish Grupo Zena.

== Brands portfolio ==
Alsea has the rights to manage and open restaurants from these brands as follows:

==Recent news==
In September 2013, Alsea acquired 362 [[Walmex]] restaurants Vips and El Porton for around $626 million.<ref>{{cite news| url=https://www.reuters.com/article/2013/09/10/us-mexico-alsea-walmex-idUSBRE9891A220130910| title=Mexico's Alsea to buy Walmex restaurant chain for 8.2 billion pesos| author=Elinor Comlay| publisher=Reuters | date=10 September 2013}}</ref>
